name: BigMac index
description: The price for a Big Mac by McDonald's derived from www.bigmacindex.org (unit: USD).

name: Birth rate
description: The average number of birth per year per 1,000 population.

name: CO2 emission
description: The CO2 emissions in metric tons per person per year.

name: Corruption
description: The Corruption Perceptions Index (CPI) published by www.transparency.org (scale: 0-100, 0 = high corruption. 100 = low corruption)

name: Death rate
description: The average number of death per year per 1,000 population.

name: Debts
description: The total amount of government borrowings (unit: USD)

name: Debts per person
description: The amount of government borrowings per person (unit: USD).

name: Debts to the GDP
description: The percentage of government borrowings in relation to the Gross Domestic Product.

name: Diabetes
description: The percentage of people ages 20-79 who have type 1 or type 2 diabetes.

name: Expenditure on education
description: The public expenditure on education (in % of the GDP for a country).

name: Electric energy consumed
description: The amount of electric energy consumed (in kWh/capita)

name: FIFA rank
description: The ranking of a country in the FIFA football ranking board.

name: First marriage men
description: The age of first marriage for men

name: First marriage women
description: The age of first marriage for women.

name: Phone subscriptions
description: The number of landline phone subscriptions (per 100 population)

name: Forest area
description: The total amount of forest area in a country (in km)

name: Forest area percent
description: The percentage of the land area covered by a forest for a country.

name: GDP total
description: The total Gross Domestic Product (GDP) for a country (unit: USD).

name: GDP per person
description: The Gross Domestic Product per person for a country (unit: USD).

name: Gini coefficient
description: The Gini coefficient states how uniformly assets are distributed in a country (scale: 0-100; 0 = equal distribution. 100 = unequal distribution)

name: Happiness index
description: The values of the world happiness survey of the UNSDSN (see http://worldhappiness.report/). The higher the value, the happier the country.

name: Human Dev. Index
description: The Human Development Index (HDI). It is published by the United Nations and combines several parameters (e.g. life expectancy or GDP). Scale: 0-1; 0 = low development. 1 = high development.

name: Expenditure on health
description: The public expenditure on health (in % of the GDP for a country).

name: HIV prevalence
description: The percentage of people ages 15-49 who are infected with HIV

name: Inflation
description: The annual change of consumer prices (unit: %).

name: Internetuser
description: The total number of people that are actively using the internet.

name: Internetusers percent
description: The percentage of people, that are actively using the internet for a country.

name: Jobless rate
description: The number of unemployed people in relation to the labor force for a country.

name: Life expectancy
description: The average number of years a person will live (at birth).

name: Literacy rate
description: The percentage of people, that have the ability to read and write by the age of 15.

name: Median wage
description: The median monthly wage before taxes including public benefits (e.g child allowance); unit: USD.

name: Median age
description: The median age of the population.

name: Migration
description: The total number of people that emigrated or immigrated.

name: Migration rate
description: The net migration rate (per 1,000 population).

name: Military expenditure
description: The military budget (in % of the GDP for a country).

name: Mobile cellular
description: The number of mobile phone subscriptions (per 100 population)

name: Murder rate
description: The number of homicides (per 100,000 population).

name: New businesses
description: Number of new limited liability corporations registered in the calendar year.

name: Olympic goldmedals
description: The number of gold medals a country won at the Olympic Games.

name: Olympic silver medals
description: The number of silver medals a country won at the Olympic Games.

name: Olympic bronze medals
description: The number of bronze medals a country won at the Olympic Games.

name: Population
description: The population of a country.

name: Population density
description: The population density of a country (per km).

name: Population 0-14
description: The percentage of people between the age 0 and 14.

name: Population 15-64
description: The percentage of of people between the age 15 and 64.

name: Population over 64
description: The percentage of people who are older than 64 years.

name: Pressfreedom index
description: An index derived from 'Reporters' without borders that reflects how free the press of a country is. The lower the value, the better the freedom of press.

name: Research expenditure
description: The public expenditures on scientific research (in % of the GDP for a country).

name: Scientific articles
description: The number of scientific publications in medical or natural sciences.

name: Size
description: Returns the area of a country (unit: km).

name: tax_revenue
description: Compulsory transfers to the central government for public purposes (in % of the GDP for a country).

name: tax_revenue_total
description: Compulsory transfers to the central government for public purposes (in US-Dollar).

name: Tourist arrivals
description: The number of foreign citizens that stayed at least one night in the country. This includes hotel stays, transfers, conference visits, etc.

name: Tourism expenditure
description: The amount of expenditures dedicated for tourism (in % of the GDP for a country).

name: Urban population
description: Returns the percentage of people who live in a city.
